title.bibl: Interview with Padre Catatina, Pastor of the Mexican Catholic Church, 91st and Brandon Avenue, know as Tempo de Guadalupe, also as St. Judas Tadeus Chicago Ill., by Nicolas M. Hernandez, Dec. 10, 1936.

div.bibl: Interview with Padre Catatina, Pastor of The Mexican Catholic Church, 91st and Brandon Avenue, know as Tempo de Guadalupe, also as St. Judas Tadeus Chicago Ill., by Nicolas M. Hernandez, Dec. 10, 1936.

body.p: There are 5,700 Church. According to the census of 1935, we have belong to our Church. We have religious services four , every day of the week. We have six religious societies. 1. , with $69 members, 2. Socieded del Santo , 420 members, Society $75 members, 4. Infants (children) $25 members, 5. Corazon de Jesus 620 members. Society No. 1. , is the President, and has 12 officers. No. 2. Roberto Lopez, is the President, an has 15 officers. No. 3. Isabel de Gomez, is the President and has 25 officers. No. 4. Jesus Villa, is the President and has 8 officers, No. 3. Genaro Anaya, is the President and has 6 officers, No. 6. Rumaldo Perales, is the President and has 14, officers. We have classes in English and Spanish for adults of both sexes 4 evenings a week.

About 80 adults attend the classes. Also, we teach the following: Singing, music, sewing, drawing, handicraft, arithmetic, physics, sociology, popular science an flower making.I cannot say how many people attend each class, however the attendance varies, because the people work different shifts, most every member attends to some of the classes above mentioned. All of the 8,020 Mexicans are do not interest us. We have a school for a I can say that we benefit the City of Chicago by making them good citizens; to be good workers and faithful to their jobs.
